column4: basically where can i find an nvidia driver version older than the current (ONLY) one nvidia offers?
there isn't a driver archive at their site?
i cant find it
the site just seems to show the current one
http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux_display_archive.html
correction: i can't find CUDA drivers. i need CUDA
sorry
wasnt clear
Is there a separate CUDA driver? doesn't the regular linux display driver support CUDA?
i'm almost positive you have to have a CUDA specific driver
http://www.nvidia.com/object/cuda_get.html
because when you click on the download cuda driver link you're redirected to the regular display driver.. or that's what it looks like
by god it looks like i am. why the f....
i guess i'll give that a shot. geez
so cuda is just built in all the drivers?
I would think so.. I have no idea when they started with CUDA though..might be a break off point at some time in history
argh, my next issue is that the drivers on that page are x86
you choose that on the same page.. linux 32bit or linux 64bit.. just above the actual link
from the driver archive? i'm not being offered choice
http://www.nvidia.com/object/cuda_get.html
ah, finally found a special 64 archive
